Class Book

java.lang.Object
Book
Direct Known Subclasses:
FictionBook, NonFictionBook, ReferenceBook
public class Book extends Object
The Book class represents a book with basic details such as book code, title, author, genre, and quantity in stock. It also provides methods to manage the book's inventory and determine its borrowable status.

  • Constructor Details

    • Book

      public Book()
      Default constructor.

    • Book

      public Book(int bookCode, String title, String author, String genre, int quantityInStock)
      Parameterized constructor to initialize a book with its details.
      Parameters:
      bookCode - The unique code of the book.
      title - The title of the book.
      author - The author of the book.
      genre - The genre of the book.
      quantityInStock - The quantity of the book available in stock.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the book object, including its book code, title, author, genre, and the quantity in stock.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string containing the book's details.

    • updateQuantity

      public boolean updateQuantity(int amount)
      Updates the quantity of the book in stock by a specified amount. The operation fails if the new quantity would be negative.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount by which to update the quantity.
      Returns:
      true if the quantity is successfully updated, false if the operation would result in a negative stock.

    • isEqual

      public boolean isEqual(Book book)
      Compares two books based on their title and author.
      Parameters:
      book - The book to compare with.
      Returns:
      true if both books have the same title and author, false otherwise.

    • addBook

      public boolean addBook(Scanner scanner)
      Adds a book by prompting the user for its details using the Scanner.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The Scanner object to read input from.
      Returns:
      true after successfully adding the book.

    • getBookCode

      public int getBookCode()
      Gets the book code.
      Returns:
      The code of the book.

    • getQuantityInStock

      public int getQuantityInStock()
      Gets the quantity of the book in stock.
      Returns:
      The quantity of the book available in stock.

    • setQuantityInStock

      public void setQuantityInStock(int quantity)
      Sets the quantity of the book in stock.
      Parameters:
      quantity - The new quantity of the book.

    • isBorrowable

      public boolean isBorrowable()
      Determines if the book is borrowable. By default, all books are borrowable unless specified otherwise by subclasses.
      Returns:
      true if the book is borrowable, false otherwise.
